positive.review: This game is great, simple fun. Valve should consider updating it.
BRUH this game is addicting and is super fun if you have friends to play it with too wish it got more updates and i miss some of the old synergies

"A brilliant mix of strategy and luck, Dota Underlords delivers deep tactical gameplay with Dota’s classic heroes. The visuals and animations are polished, and every match feels unique. Though updates have slowed, it remains one of the best auto-battlers for players who enjoy smart strategy and competition."

It would be great if we had a chance to play this at 2vs2 in real time.
The good point is you can try it even on android phone when your computer isn't available to you.

Игра Dota Underlords — это эталонный автобаттлер, блестяще сочетающий стратегию и доступность. Глубокая механика сборки команд и тактического планирования затягивает на сотни часов. Отличная графика, регулярные обновления и сбалансированный мета-геймплей делают каждую партию уникальной и увлекательной. Обязательна к знакомству всем фанатам жанра.

Come for the classic Valve charm, stay because you've been waiting 20 minutes for a ranked match and now you're too invested to quit. Dota Underlords isn't just a game; it's a historical monument to a genre's early days and a cautionary tale about trusting a studio that names its own employees after numbers. Five stars for the concept, zero stars for the future. And that's okay. It doesn't need one.

[h2][b]A Finished Masterpiece: The Best Free-to-Play Auto-Battler You Forgot About[/b][/h2]
[hr][/hr]

[h3][b]TL;DR: The Perfect Static Strategy Game[/b][/h3]
[b]Dota Underlords[/b] is highly recommended, but with a major caveat: it is no longer actively developed. You should not view this as a live service game; view it as a 100% complete, free-to-play digital board game. The core gameplay loop—building a strategic crew, managing your economy, and combining powerful Alliance bonuses—is refined, deeply complex, and delivers an unmatched level of tactical depth in the genre.

It offers exceptional value. There are absolutely [b]NO[/b] gameplay-altering microtransactions, the technical performance is flawless, and the PC/Mobile cross-play is seamless. If you are looking for a highly polished, strategically rigorous, and totally consumer-friendly game you can sink hundreds of hours into, the answer is an unequivocal [b]YES[/b].

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Core Analysis: The Depth of White Spire[/h2]

[b]Dota Underlords[/b] succeeds by offering a high-variance, low-luck strategic framework. Every game begins with a chaotic rush of RNG, but the true skill is in your mid-game pivot. Unlike its competitors, [i]Underlords[/i] forces you to consider multiple layers of strategy simultaneously. You're not just aiming for a single composition; you are actively building an ecosystem of units, items, and your titular [b]Underlord[/b]—a persistent hero unit that drastically shifts your overall strategy.

The game's signature mechanics, such as the powerful [b]Alliance[/b] combinations (like stacking 'Hunters' or the game-changing utility of 'Knights') and the crucial unit positioning, require constant adaptation. For example, positioning a low-HP unit with a high-impact ability (like an AoE stun) in a seemingly vulnerable back-row position, only to have them shielded by a 'Savage' summon, can win a critical late-game round. This level of tactical micro-management ensures victory is decided by wit, not wallet.

The monetization is the single most consumer-friendly model in the F2P landscape. Everything is unlocked immediately. The Season One Battle Pass is purely cosmetic, consisting of boards, profile flair, and weather effects—and while no new seasons will come, what is there is permanent. This is a rare, uncompromised experience from a major studio that respects your time and your money.

[h2]Technical Assessment & Value Proposition[/h2]
The game is excellently optimized. The UI is clean, controls are snappy, and the load times are minimal. Because development was effectively ceased after the 1.0 release, the game is now in a hyper-stable, bug-free state. This is a major advantage over constantly patched, volatile live service games. It runs perfectly on Steam Deck (Verified) and maintains seamless cross-play with the mobile version, making it the ideal pick-up-and-play strategy title for commuting or relaxing on the couch.

[h2]The Verdict: Why You Should Still Play It[/h2]

[h3][b]PROS[/b][/h3]
[list]
[*]Deep, complex strategic gameplay with high replay value and rewarding tactical positioning.
[*]True Free-to-Play: Zero gameplay-altering purchases or loot box mechanics.
[*]Flawless technical polish, smooth performance, and Steam Deck Verified status.
[*]Seamless cross-play between PC and mobile devices.
[*]The 'City Crawl' single-player/puzzle mode offers a unique way to practice mechanics.
[/list]

[h3][b]CONS[/b][/h3]
[list]
[*]Development is halted; do not expect new heroes, alliances, or seasons.
[*]Lower concurrent player count can lead to longer queue times, especially outside of peak hours.
[*]Steep learning curve; the game provides little hand-holding for its intricacies.
[*]The competitive meta is static and 'solved' at the highest echelons of play.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

If you can accept the game as a 'final edition' product—a strategic classic that will never be updated—it stands as one of the best auto-battlers ever released. Its excellent design, coupled with Valve's commitment to a purely F2P model, makes [b]Dota Underlords[/b] a must-have for strategy enthusiasts. It is a time capsule of premium, tactical goodness that won't cost you a penny.
Intelligent, cute and smart game. Relaxing to some. Too bad it does not get updates anymore :(

Good game but can easily get stale after playing for some time.

Haven't gotten an update for going on 5 years now.

Dota Underlords is like chess—if chess had explosions, gambling, and a mysterious dead crime boss named Momma Eeb. You’ll spend hours building the perfect team, only to get destroyed by some guy who accidentally stacked six of the same heroes and calls it “strategy.” Every victory feels earned, every defeat feels like you’ve just been mugged by RNG itself. The game’s got depth, drama, and enough chaos to make your brain feel like it’s doing calculus on fire. 9/10, would lose another 30-minute match to a guy with a dancing Underlord again.
It looks like it's made for kids but it is pretty complex and fun
This game is great, simple fun. Valve should consider updating it.

A surprisingly engaging autobattler that's perfect for quick sessions or longer strategic plays. Despite being simpler than other games in the genre, it still provides enough depth and replayability to keep coming back. A solid choice for mobile or PC.
Excelente jogo, só falta voltar a receber updates

This is Valve's take on an auto battler that is based on DOTA 2 lore. It looks simple at first but can get pretty complex. Although there does not appear to new updates at this time. It is free so not much to complain about since it is quite polished for what it is.
Well... it's what it is... mindless fun with a bit of gambling elements

It would be great if we had a chance to play this at 2vs2 in real time.
The good point is you can try it even on android phone when your computer isn't available to you.

Игра Dota Underlords — это эталонный автобаттлер, блестяще сочетающий стратегию и доступность. Глубокая механика сборки команд и тактического планирования затягивает на сотни часов. Отличная графика, регулярные обновления и сбалансированный мета-геймплей делают каждую партию уникальной и увлекательной. Обязательна к знакомству всем фанатам жанра.
Bring this back please its an amazing game and just needs updates.

negative.review: This game is the worst version of autochess. *could* have been good. Isn't. Is abandoned. Fuck it.  And I have too many hours to know better XD

Shi is absolutely trash, its just 3 star rush, with minimal descriptions. Cant even enjoy trying to play on a new account because it puts you against braindead one tricks rushing particular builds. Not to mention a 5 minute que to experience this trash. What a dogshi game
Interesting concept, tft with heroes. There just seems to be too much shit going on. Aslo like there’s preset comps which I don’t get at all, seems really dumb.
valve forgot about this game, last update is from before covid
Unpolished. Jenky graphics.
The RNG is terrible in this game.
good

Very luck based, sometimes you will never get anything you need to win. To much % chances at getting good units that can make big differences. But if you re-roll 6 times and only get nature units when doing a beast build, its like.... what are you even suppose to do? 

Plus there isnt a like unit roster to read what all the units do. You cant pre go learn things, just hope 15 ish seconds is fast enough to read multiple units long paragraph descriptions only after hovering.

Meh, fun but bad game design. At least add a unit list to read through
This game is the worst version of autochess. *could* have been good. Isn't. Is abandoned. Fuck it.  And I have too many hours to know better XD
remake of Auto Chess this version is not worth getting for free     tutorial is an epic fail it don't explain 75% of the basic things u need to know to play
Interesting concept, tft with heroes. There just seems to be too much shit going on. Aslo like there’s preset comps which I don’t get at all, seems really dumb.
valve forgot about this game, last update is from before covid

Dota Underlords is like playing chess if all the pieces decided to move on their own, ignore your strategy, and then die in the most humiliating way possible. You don’t actually play the game, you just sit there like a proud parent watching your children throw hands in a bar fight they will almost certainly lose.

The tutorial explains the basics, then immediately throws you into matches where some guy named “xX420SniperXx” pulls out a galaxy-brain strategy you couldn’t invent even if you had Elon Musk’s IQ and three lifetimes to study.

Every round feels less like strategy and more like praying to RNGesus that your shop doesn’t serve you the same useless hero for the 8th time in a row.

It’s free to play, but the real cost is your dignity as you realize you’re being beaten by someone who just started playing 5 minutes ago.

Would I recommend it? Only if you enjoy the thrill of losing to slot machines disguised as chess.

2/10, uninstalling before my pieces embarrass me again.
Valve abandoned this masterpiece and the queue times are horrible. RIP
Unpolished. Jenky graphics.
